title: Compiler panics after restructuring of project: attempted .def_id() on invalid def: PrimTy(Float(f64))

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hello,

I was working on my toy project here:
https://github.com/smukherjee2016/sayo_pbr_rs

The project was compiling and running fine at this commit:
https://github.com/smukherjee2016/sayo_pbr_rs/commit/e8f071cb36a434d41c2ea8b863f3378a422e1a97

However, I decided I wanted to move functionality out of ```src/lib.rs``` and into ```src/scene/mod.rs```, so I moved all of it except the ```mod``` declarations, and then tried to compile. This led to the compiler panic.

The repro commit for this:
https://github.com/smukherjee2016/sayo_pbr_rs/commit/ecf225ff732c6dcf9bd4831ecb99ae157da2e447

I am using CLion, and the command I run is simply ```cargo run```.

I am pretty new to Rust so it might just be me doing something really wrong, but it'd be great if someone could look into this and advise. Thank you!

With ```stable-msvc```:
